unit_type.tooltip: Base data unit shown in the panel

update_every.tooltip: How often to calculate download and upload speed

update_available_interfaces_every.tooltip: How often to update list of available network interfaces. 0 means list of available network interfaces is not updated periodically.

gui_value_order.tooltip: An order of values shown in the panel and in the hover popup

decimal_places.tooltip: Decimal places of download and upload speed shown in the panel

gui_text_css.tooltip: A CSS style applied to the text in the panel

gui_received_icon_filename.tooltip:
An icon displayed next to download speed in the panel.
To display a symbolic icon make sure its name ends with '-symbolic.svg'.

gui_sent_icon_filename.tooltip:
An icon displayed next to upload speed in the panel.
To display a symbolic icon make sure its name ends with '-symbolic.svg'.

gui_symbolic_icon.description: Show a default set of symbolic icons

hover_popup_text_css.tooltip: A CSS style applied to the description text in the hover popup

hover_popup_numbers_css.tooltip: A CSS style applied to numbers in the hover popup

minimum_bytes_received_to_display.tooltip: A minimum download value to display in the panel

minimum_bytes_sent_to_display.tooltip: A minimum upload value to display in the panel

show_hover.description: Show total download and upload on hover
show_hover.tooltip: Show the hover popup with total amount of data downloaded and uploaded

bytes_start_time.tooltip: Start time to count total amount of data downloaded and uploaded

custom_start_date.tooltip: A custom date in YYYY-MM-DD format used as start time. The option is used if "Custom date" is selected in "Start" combobox.

write_every.tooltip: How often to save total amount of data downloaded and uploaded to the file. 0 means no saving to the file.

data_limit.tooltip: The maximum amount of data to download and upload. 0 means no limits.

gui_data_limit_type.tooltip: Show the percentage of data limit used in the panel

data_limit_command_enabled.description: Invoke command when data limit exceeded
data_limit_command_enabled.tooltip: Invoke a command when amount of data downloaded and uploaded exceeded the limit

data_limit_command.default: echo \"Data limit exceeded. This terminal will close in 5 seconds.\"; sleep 5; exit 0;

launch_terminal.description: List current Internet connections on left mouse click
launch_terminal.tooltip: Open a terminal with a list of current connections on a left mouse click. The next click closes the terminal.

list_connections_command.tooltip: A command used to list current Internet connections
